recipes.name: Salmon with Brown Sugar Glaze
recipes.ingredients: Cooking spray, 4(6 Ounce) boneless salmon fillets, salt and ground black pepper to taste, ¼ cup packed light brown sugar, and 2 tablespoons of Dijon Mustard.
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven broiler and set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source. Grease the rack of a broiler pan with cooking spray. Season salmon with salt and pepper, then place on the prepared broiler pan. Whisk together brown sugar and mustard in a small bowl; spoon mixture evenly over salmon. Cook under the preheated broiler until fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Yummy Pork Chops
recipes.ingredients: 2 cups Italian-style salad dressing, ¼ cup soy sauce, ½ teaspoon pepper, and 4 boneless pork chops
recipes.instructions: In a bowl, mix the Italian-style salad dressing, soy sauce, and pepper. Place the pork chops in a skillet over medium heat, and cover with the dressing mixture. Cover skillet, and cook pork chops 25 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove cover, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking to desired doneness.

recipes.name: Three-Ingredient Baked Chicken Breasts
recipes.ingredients: ¼ cup butter melted, 1 teaspoon salt, 4 skinless and boneless chicken breast halves
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter a baking dish. Stir together melted butter and salt in a bowl. Arrange chicken in the prepared baking dish. Brush butter mixture onto chicken until thoroughly coated, pouring any extra over chicken. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 30 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees Fahrenheit
